abstract.text: Allows tracking and user interface feedback of scroll wheel events.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The swipe tracking events. See
for possible values.

The minimum dampen threshold. This value is considered to encompass the “current view content area” and is referred to as a page. This is the number of pages with a negative position relative to the current page. The value must be less than or equal to zero.

The maximum dampen threshold. This value is considered to encompass the “current view content area” and is referred to as a page. This is the number of pages with a positive position relative to the current page. The value must be greater than or equal to zero.
The Block used as the tracking handler.
The Block takes four arguments:
The amount of gesture that you should display in the user interface. This may be a fractional amount.
gestureAmount
The direction of the gestureAmount matches the user’s “scroll content” preference setting as set in
, which is based on a user preference.
Upon completion, the gesture amount will animate to one of the following values: -1, 0, 1.
The phase of the physical gesture as performed by the user. See
for possible values. When the phase is either
, or
, the user has physically ended the gesture successfully or un-successfully, respectively.
phase
Your handler will continue to be called with updated progress values to complete the fluid swipe animation with a phase of
Signifies the swipe and animation are complete and you should release any temporary animation objects.
isComplete
The
is released and will not be called further.
A reference to a Boolean value. The Block can set the value to
to stop further processing of the array. The
argument is an out-only argument. You should only ever set this Boolean to
within the Block
stop

Scroll wheel swipes are tracked not only to the end of the physical gesture phase by the user, but also to the completion of any user interface animation that should be performed. Using this method allows your implementation to maintain a consistent fluid feel with other applications. Any gesture amount outside of the supplied minimum and maximum dampen amount is pre-dampened for you to provide an elastic feel.
The swipe
that would fall outside of the range specified by the
and
are automatically dampened. For example, the user’s physical swipe action results in a value of .50, however, there is no page in that direction to swipe to. The
reported is adjusted by a damping factor resulting in something like .125. As a developer, you simply treat the
like you normally do, and the result is an elastic feedback effect to let the user know that there is nothing to swipe to in that direction.
This method returns immediately and tracking is performed asynchronously.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An object that contains information about an input action, such as a mouse click or a key press.
Constants that represent the possible phases during an event phase.
The system event phase may begin.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the user has changed the device inversion.
A Boolean value that indicates whether to track fluid swipe gestures using scroll events.
Allows tracking and user interface feedback of scroll wheel events.
The event is not associated with a phase.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
The basic type for all floating-point values.
The basic type for floating-point scalar values in Core Graphics and related frameworks.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
